channel.title: Plz help me i dont understand why this is happnin
channel.description:
this pops up when i try and start SCAR with Sumilions Rimmington Miner Include file C:Program FilesSCAR 3.12includesSRLSRL.scar does not exist. Include file C:Program FilesSCAR 3.12includesSRLSRLskillMining.scar does not exist. Failed when compiling
can some one tell me what to do to fix it plzz [center][img]http://www.moparisthebest.org/smf/Themes/default/images/warnwarn.gif[/img] Do not double or triple post please.[/center]

item.title: Plz help me i dont understand why this is happnin
item.dc:creator: @jvwarrior jvwarrior
item.description:
@jvwarrior wrote:

yes those scripts are old and not compatible with SRL 4 or watever u hav so thats ure problem

Read full topic
item.source: Plz help me i dont understand why this is happnin

item.title: Plz help me i dont understand why this is happnin
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

Because the script your using uses and older version of SRL,
In SRL 4 + they use an array for Strings & so forth.

You’ll need to find a more updated script

Read full topic

item.title: Plz help me i dont understand why this is happnin
item.dc:creator: @ninkil_karp ninkil karp
item.description:
@ninkil_karp wrote:

ok i did that and now it seems to be working but then this came up

Line 66: [Error] (15398:12): Unknown identifier ‘STRING1’ in script C:\Program Files\SCAR 3.12\scripts\downloaded\SRM_v0.13.scar

what do i do?[br][size=1]Posted on: November 09, 2007, 11:02:27 AM[/size][hr]oh and this is wat the line 66 looks like

Players[0].Name := ‘’; // Your Runescape name
Players[0].Pass := ‘’; // The corresponding password
Players[0].Nick := ‘nin’; // 3-4 letters from your name, NO CAPITALS (that includes the first character)
Players[0].String1 := ‘Iron’; // Type of ore to mine (Clay / Copper / Tin / Iron / Gold)
Players[0].String2 := ‘0000’; // Your BankPinNumber
Players[0].Active := True;[br][size=1]Posted on: November 09, 2007, 11:03:35 AM[/size][hr]its the string1 := ‘Iron’
